required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Extension Study of Patients Successfully Treated by Ziprasidone in Study A1281031
clinical_study.official_title: Open Extension Study Evaluating The Long Term Efficacy , Safety And Tolerability Of Oral Ziprasidone In The Treatment Of Patients Who Have Successfully Completed The Previous Ziprasidone Study A1281031

brief_summary.textblock: Open label extension study of Ziprasidone, evaluation of safety of long term use of ziprasidone

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Categorical Scores on Clinical Global Impression - Improvement (CGI-I)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year, 3 years, 5 years, End of Study [LOCF]

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in CGI-I at End of Study (up to 5 Years)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, up to 5 years (End of Study [LOCF])

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Categorical Scores on Clinical Global Impression of Severity (CGI-S)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year, 3 years, 5 years, End of Study [LOCF]

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in CGI-S at End of Study (up to 5 Years)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, up to 5 years (End of Study [LOCF])

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Scores on Patient Preference Scale (PPS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, up to 5 years (End of Study)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Drug Attitude Inventory (DAI) at End of Study (up to 5 Years)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, up to 5 years (End of Study)

intervention.description: Dosage may subsequently be adjusted according to clinical status, only at each protocol visit and step by step between 40, 60 and 80 mg bid

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who successfully completed study A1281031 (CGI score of 1 or 2 at final visit) or ZIP-NY-98035 and with QTc <= 500 msec.
Exclusion Criteria:
- All other patients who do not fit the inclusion criteria as stated above.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Ziprasidone maintenance dosing of 40 to 80 milligrams twice daily

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Ziprasidone maintenance dosing of 40 to 80 milligrams twice daily

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Categorical Scores on Clinical Global Impression - Improvement (CGI-I)
outcome.description: CGI-I consists of a 7-point clinician rated scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improvement is defined as a score of 1 (very much improved), 2 (much improved), or 3 (minimally improved) on the scale.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year, 3 years, 5 years, End of Study [LOCF]
outcome.population: Intention to treat (ITT), all patients who received at least one dose of study medication and who have at least one post baseline efficacy evaluation. Imputation at Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF).

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Ziprasidone maintenance dosing of 40 to 80 milligrams twice daily

measure.title: Number of Participants With Categorical Scores on Clinical Global Impression - Improvement (CGI-I)
measure.description: CGI-I consists of a 7-point clinician rated scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improvement is defined as a score of 1 (very much improved), 2 (much improved), or 3 (minimally improved) on the scale.
measure.population: Intention to treat (ITT), all patients who received at least one dose of study medication and who have at least one post baseline efficacy evaluation. Imputation at Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF).

class.title: End of Study [LOCF] (n=43): very much improved

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in CGI-I at End of Study (up to 5 Years)
outcome.description: CGI-I consists of a 7-point clinician rated scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improvement is defined as a score of 1 (very much improved), 2 (much improved), or 3 (minimally improved) on the scale. Change from baseline is score at observation minus score at baseline.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, up to 5 years (End of Study [LOCF])

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Ziprasidone maintenance dosing of 40 to 80 milligrams twice daily

measure.title: Change From Baseline in CGI-I at End of Study (up to 5 Years)
measure.description: CGI-I consists of a 7-point clinician rated scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improvement is defined as a score of 1 (very much improved), 2 (much improved), or 3 (minimally improved) on the scale. Change from baseline is score at observation minus score at baseline.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Scores on Patient Preference Scale (PPS)
outcome.description: Patient rated satisfaction scale with responses: Much better, I prefer this medication, Slightly better, About the same, Slightly worse, and Much worse, I much preferred my previous medication.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, up to 5 years (End of Study)

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Ziprasidone maintenance dosing of 40 to 80 milligrams twice daily

measure.title: Number of Participants With Scores on Patient Preference Scale (PPS)
measure.description: Patient rated satisfaction scale with responses: Much better, I prefer this medication, Slightly better, About the same, Slightly worse, and Much worse, I much preferred my previous medication.

class.title: End of study (n=28): about the same

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Drug Attitude Inventory (DAI) at End of Study (up to 5 Years)
outcome.description: DAI, a 10-item scale to assess how the attitude of schizophrenia patients toward their medications may affect compliance. Respondents indicate 'true' or 'false' for each item. An overall calculated score ranges from -10 to 10, where a positive score indicated a positive subjective response (compliant), whilst a negative score indicated non-compliance. Change: score at observation minus score at baseline.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, up to 5 years (End of Study)
outcome.population: ITT. n= number of participants with analyzable data.

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Ziprasidone maintenance dosing of 40 to 80 milligrams twice daily

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Drug Attitude Inventory (DAI) at End of Study (up to 5 Years)
measure.description: DAI, a 10-item scale to assess how the attitude of schizophrenia patients toward their medications may affect compliance. Respondents indicate 'true' or 'false' for each item. An overall calculated score ranges from -10 to 10, where a positive score indicated a positive subjective response (compliant), whilst a negative score indicated non-compliance. Change: score at observation minus score at baseline.
measure.population: ITT. n= number of participants with analyzable data.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Categorical Scores on Clinical Global Impression of Severity (CGI-S)
outcome.description: CGI-S Scale: standardized assessment tool to rate severity of subject’s illness; assessed investigator’s impression of subject’s current illness state. Score: 1 (normal - not ill at all) to 7 (among the most extremely ill patients).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year, 3 years, 5 years, End of Study [LOCF]

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Ziprasidone maintenance dosing of 40 to 80 milligrams twice daily

measure.title: Number of Participants With Categorical Scores on Clinical Global Impression of Severity (CGI-S)
measure.description: CGI-S Scale: standardized assessment tool to rate severity of subject’s illness; assessed investigator’s impression of subject’s current illness state. Score: 1 (normal - not ill at all) to 7 (among the most extremely ill patients).

class.title: Baseline (n=43): normal, not ill at all
3 months (n=35): normal, not ill at all
6 months (n=34): normal, not ill at all
1 year (n=27): normal, not ill at all
3 years (n=10): normal, not ill at all
5 years (n=7): normal, not ill at all
End of Study [LOCF] (n=43): normal, not ill at all

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in CGI-S at End of Study (up to 5 Years)
outcome.description: CGI-S Scale: standardized assessment tool to rate severity of subject’s illness; assesses investigator’s impression of subject’s current illness state. Score: 1 (normal - not ill at all) to 7 (among the most extremely ill). Change: score at observation minus score at baseline.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, up to 5 years (End of Study [LOCF])

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Ziprasidone maintenance dosing of 40 to 80 milligrams twice daily

measure.title: Change From Baseline in CGI-S at End of Study (up to 5 Years)
measure.description: CGI-S Scale: standardized assessment tool to rate severity of subject’s illness; assesses investigator’s impression of subject’s current illness state. Score: 1 (normal - not ill at all) to 7 (among the most extremely ill). Change: score at observation minus score at baseline.

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Ziprasidone maintenance dosing of 40 to 80 milligrams twice daily

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of < 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), < 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
